title: How to Boil Chicken
description:
Learn How to Boil Chicken with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Boil-Chicken

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to boil chicken first place boneless skinless chicken breasts in a large pot and fill the pot with enough water to cover them season the water with salt and pepper to give the chicken more flavor add carrots onions and fresh herbs for even more flavor if you'd like then bring the water to a boil cover the pot and reduce to a rapid simmer for 10 minutes or until the chicken has an internal temperature of 165 degrees Fahrenheit 75 degrees Celsius remove the chicken breasts from the pot and let them cool for 10 minutes finally use two forks to shred the chicken or cut it into thin slices with a knife to boil a whole chicken follow the same steps but let the chicken simmer for one-and-a-half to two hours so it cooks all the way throughto boil chicken first place boneless skinless chicken breasts in a large pot and fill the pot with enough water to cover them season the water with salt and pepper to give the chicken more flavor add carrots onions and fresh herbs for even more flavor if you'd like then bring the water to a boil cover the pot and reduce to a rapid simmer for 10 minutes or until the chicken has an internal temperature of 165 degrees Fahrenheit 75 degrees Celsius remove the chicken breasts from the pot and let them cool for 10 minutes finally use two forks to shred the chicken or cut it into thin slices with a knife to boil a whole chicken follow the same steps but let the chicken simmer for one-and-a-half to two hours so it cooks all the way through

subtitles: if your chicken breast is frozen defrost it in a bowl of cold water or in the microwave before boiling then put your defrosted chicken breast in a large pot full of water so it's completely submerged bring the water to a boil and then reduce it to a simmer and cover the pot cook the chicken for 30 minutes or until the inside isn't pink once it's cooked the only thing left to do is drain the pot and transfer the chicken breast to a plate for serving check the description below for more information including the full articleif your chicken breast is frozen defrost it in a bowl of cold water or in the microwave before boiling then put your defrosted chicken breast in a large pot full of water so it's completely submerged bring the water to a boil and then reduce it to a simmer and cover the pot cook the chicken for 30 minutes or until the inside isn't pink once it's cooked the only thing left to do is drain the pot and transfer the chicken breast to a plate for serving check the description below for more information including the full article

description:

subtitles: for delicious hard-boiled eggs first put your eggs in a large saucepan and cover them with one inch of water bring the water to a boil then turn off the heat cover the saucepan and let it sit for 6 to 15 minutes then remove your eggs with a slotted spoon and submerge them in an ice bath to cool them down before handling to make a soft-boiled egg bring water to a boil then decrease the heat to a simmer and add the eggs let simmer for 5 to 7 minutes cool the eggs down and enjoyfor delicious hard-boiled eggs first put your eggs in a large saucepan and cover them with one inch of water bring the water to a boil then turn off the heat cover the saucepan and let it sit for 6 to 15 minutes then remove your eggs with a slotted spoon and submerge them in an ice bath to cool them down before handling to make a soft-boiled egg bring water to a boil then decrease the heat to a simmer and add the eggs let simmer for 5 to 7 minutes cool the eggs down and enjoy

subtitles: to bread fish first crack three large eggs in a bowl and whisk them thoroughly fill a separate bowl with breadcrumbs and another bowl with all-purpose flour then dry off your thawed fish fillets with paper towels take the first fillet and dip both sides in the flour so it's completely coated then dip both sides of the fillet in the egg mixture don't worry if a little flour comes off finally dip both sides of the fillet in the breadcrumbs place each fillet on a plate when you finish breading it to pan fry the fish first spread 1 to 2 teaspoons five to ten milliliters of oil around in a pan place the fillets in the pan and cook them over medium-high heat for three to ten minutes depending on how thick they are then flip the fillets over and cook the other side for 3 to 10 minutes to bake the fillets in the oven first preheat your oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit 190 degrees celsius line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray it with non-stick cooking spray then set the fillets on the sheet and bake them in the oven for 10 to 20 minutes depending on how thick they are youto bread fish first crack three large eggs in a bowl and whisk them thoroughly fill a breading it to pan fry the fish first spread 1 to 2 teaspoons five to ten milliliters of oil around in a pan place the fillets in the pan and cook them over medium-high heat for three to ten minutes depending on how thick they are then flip the fillets over and cook the other side for 3 to 10 minutes to bake the fillets in the oven first preheat your oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit 190 degrees celsius line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray it with non-stick cooking spray then set the fillets on the sheet and bake them in the oven for 10 to 20 minutes depending on how thick they title: How to Brine a Turkey
description:
Brining your bird is ESSENTIAL for a juicy turkey! If you dread tough or dry turkey, take the time to brine it before roasting. 

To brine:
Create a flavorful solution of vegetable stock, salt, and seasonings. Submerge a THAWED turkey in the brine along with lots of ice water and leave it to chill for at least 8 to 16 hours. Remove the turkey from the brine and pat it dry. Then, roast the turkey until it reaches 165 °F (74 °C) and enjoy!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Brine-a-Turkey

title: How to Broil Lobster
description:
Learn how to broil lobster with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Broil-Lobster

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to broil a lobster start by setting the live lobster on a cutting board place the tip of a chef's knife one inch 2.5 centimeters above the first striation then hold the lobster down with your free hand and quickly insert the knife straight down through the lobster bring the blade down so it's parallel to the cutting board to humanely kill the lobster cook the lobster in boiling water for five minutes then transfer it to a bowl of ice water to cool preheat your broiler and cut the lobster in half lengthwise place the halves cut side up on a baking sheet and brush the meat with melted butter broil the lobster for six to eight minutes or until it's golden brown and cooked through finally season the lobster with salt and enjoyto broil a lobster start by setting the live lobster on a cutting board place the tip of a chef's knife one inch 2.5 centimeters above the first striation then hold the lobster down with your free hand and quickly insert the knife straight down through the lobster bring the blade down so it's parallel to the cutting board to humanely kill the lobster cook the lobster in boiling water for five minutes then transfer it to a bowl of ice water to cool preheat your broiler and cut the lobster in half lengthwise place the halves cut side up on a baking sheet and brush the meat with melted butter broil the lobster for six to eight minutes or until it's golden brown and cooked through finally season the lobster with salt and enjoy

subtitles: the easiest way to burn sage is to purchase pre-bundled sticks of the dried herb online or from a local shop open the doors or windows then place the bundle in a ceramic dish bowl incense tray or other non-flammable vessel light one end of the sage stick with a match or lighter let it burn for a few seconds then blow out the flame to release the smoke walk slowly around each room wafting the smoke in all directions don't forget to disable any smoke alarms in your house before you startthe easiest way to burn sage is to purchase pre-bundled sticks of the dried herb online or from a local shop open the doors or windows then place the bundle in a ceramic dish bowl incense tray or other non-flammable vessel light one end of the sage stick with a match or lighter let it burn for a few seconds then blow out the flame to release the smoke walk slowly around each room wafting the smoke in all directions don't forget to disable any smoke alarms in your house before you start

title: How to Carve a Turkey
description:
HOW TO PROPERLY CARVE A TURKEY: Do you have the honor of carving your family's turkey this Thanksgiving?

While most of us know how to enjoy eating the turkey, fewer of us know how to carve the turkey carefully so as to leave more for the plate and less on the bones, as well as making it easier to eat and presentable. This skill takes a bit of figuring out, but with the help of this video, you won't have to hope that someone else can take on the task, as you'll be able to carve the turkey yourself.

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Carve-a-Turkey

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to carve a turkey start by placing it on a cutting board with a well around the edge to collect any juices that drip out be sure that the turkey has rested at room temperature for about 30 minutes after roasting begin carving the turkey by removing the drumsticks cut through the skin above the drumstick but don't cut through the joint hold the breast with one hand and the drumstick with the other and push down on the drumstick until the joint pops use a sharp knife to cut between the joint and remove the drumstick repeat on the other side then take a knife and cut away a little bit of skin from the neck end of the breast so you can see the meat locate the wishbone in the cavity with your finger and pull it out begin removing the breast meat by cutting straight along the length of the breastbone remove each side of the breast by carving along the ribcage with a sharp knife remove the wings by cutting through the joints with a sharp knife slice the breast and place them on a platter to serve remove the thighs from the drumsticks by cutting through the joints then debone the thighs by slicing around the thigh bone slice the thigh meat and place on the platter for people who enjoy dark meat add your wings and drumsticks to the platter and serveto carve a turkey start by placing it on a cutting board with a well around the edge to collect any juices that drip out be sure that the turkey has rested at room temperature for about 30 minutes after roasting begin carving the turkey by removing the drumsticks cut through the skin above the drumstick but don't cut through the joint hold the breast with one hand and the drumstick with the other and push down on the drumstick until the joint pops use a sharp knife to cut between the joint and remove the drumstick repeat on the other side then take a knife and cut away a little bit of skin from the neck end of the breast so you can see the meat locate the wishbone in the cavity with your finger and pull it out begin removing the breast meat by cutting straight along the length of the breastbone remove each side of the breast by carving along the ribcage with a sharp knife remove the wings by cutting through the joints with a sharp knife slice the breast and place them on a platter to serve remove the thighs from the drumsticks by cutting through the joints then debone the thighs by slicing around the thigh bone slice the thigh meat and place on the platter for people who enjoy dark meat add your wings and drumsticks to the platter and serve

title: How to Cast Off
description:
This quick video will give you some tips on how to cast off!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Cast-Off

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to cast off once you've finished knitting start with the needle that's holding the project in your left hand and the other needle in your right hand then knit one regular stitch from the left needle onto the right needle repeat one more time so there are two regular stitches on the right needle now insert the tip of the left needle into the first stitch on the right needle and lift the stitch up over the top of the second stitch next knit another regular stitch onto the right needle insert the tip of the left needle into the first stitch on the right needle and lift it up over the second stitch like you did before continue the process until you've cast off all the stitches on the Left needle there should be one loop left on the right needle when you're finished cut the working end of the yarn with scissors so you're left with about a six inch or 15 centimeter tail finally put the tail through the last stitch with the right needleto cast off once you've finished knitting start with the needle that's holding the project in your left hand and the other needle in your right hand then knit one regular stitch from the left needle onto the right needle repeat one more time so there are two regular stitches on the right needle now insert the tip of the left needle into the first stitch on the right needle and lift the stitch up over the top of the second stitch next knit another regular stitch onto the right needle insert the tip of the left needle into the first stitch on the right needle and lift it up over the second stitch like you did before continue the process until you've cast off all the stitches on the Left needle there should be one loop left on the right needle when you're finished cut the working end of the yarn with scissors so you're left with about a six inch or 15 centimeter tail finally put the tail through the last stitch with the right needle

title: How to Fix Dough That Won't Rise
description:
Learn how to fix dough that won't rise with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-Dough-That-Won%27t-Rise

Video Transcript:  https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-Dough-That-Won%27t-Rise#videotranscript

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to fix dough that won't rise try placing the dough on the lowest rack in your oven along with a baking pan filled with boiling water close the oven door and let the dough rise increasing the temperature and moisture can help activate the yeast in the dough so it rises you can also try adding more yeast open a new packet of yeast and mix 1 teaspoon 3 grams of it with one cup 240 milliliters of warm water and 1 tablespoon 13 grams of sugar let the yeast mixture proof for 10 minutes then add the mixture to your dough along with some more flour so there's a ratio of 60% flour to 40% liquid knead the yeast mixture into the dough then let the dough rise in a warm moist place another option if your dough is flat and sticky to the touch is to knead in more flour keep kneading in flour until the dough is smooth and doesn't stick to your hands then let it rise somewhere warm and moistto fix dough that won't rise try placing the dough on the lowest rack in your oven along with a baking pan filled with boiling water close the oven door and let the dough rise increasing the temperature and moisture can help activate the yeast in the dough so it rises you can also try adding more yeast open a new packet of yeast and mix 1 teaspoon 3 grams of it with one cup 240 milliliters of warm water and 1 tablespoon 13 grams of sugar let the yeast mixture proof for 10 minutes then add the mixture to your dough along with some more flour so there's a ratio of 60% flour to 40% liquid knead the yeast mixture into the dough then let the dough rise in a warm moist place another option if your dough is flat and sticky to the touch is to knead in more flour keep kneading in flour until the dough is smooth and doesn't stick to your hands then let it rise somewhere warm and moist

description:

subtitles: to freeze cabbage and whole leaves start by selecting a clean cabbage and remove the coarse outer leaves then use a knife to score the head of the cabbage and pull the remaining leaves away from the base next bring a pot of water to a boil and place the leaves in the water for one to one and a half minutes after a minute or so remove the leaves from the water and put them in an ice bath immediately as the leaves cool place them in a colander to dry then transfer them to sealable plastic bags place the bags in the freezer and use as neededto freeze cabbage and whole leaves start by selecting a clean cabbage and remove the coarse outer leaves then use a knife to score the head of the cabbage and pull the remaining leaves away from the base next bring a pot of water to a boil and place the leaves in the water for one to one and a half minutes after a minute or so remove the leaves from the water and put them in an ice bath immediately as the leaves cool place them in a colander to dry then transfer them to sealable plastic bags place the bags in the freezer and use as needed
